Class Book

java.lang.Object
AbstractBookStoreItem
Book
All Implemented Interfaces:
BookStoreItem
public class Book extends AbstractBookStoreItem
This class represents a Book. A Book has a kind, title, author, year, and price.

The "kind" ("Book") is calculated by a method inherited from AbstractBookStoreItem. The other fields must be provided to super when a new Book is constructed. NB: A book can be equal to another book even if their prices are different. Book is a subclass of AbstractBookStoreItem, which implements BookStoreItem.

    • Book

      public Book(String title, Person author, int year, double price)
      Construct a new Book object that has the provided title, author, year, and price

      Parameters:
      title - , String representing the title of this book
      author - , Person who is the author of this book
      year - , int representing the year of publication
      price - , double representing the current price of this book

  • Method Details

    • sameAuthor

      public boolean sameAuthor(BookStoreItem other)
      Checks if two Books have the same author

      Parameters:
      other - , the other BookStoreItem
      Returns:
      boolean, true iff the authors are equal

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Return a formatted string that contains key information about this book.

      The string should be in the following format: Kind: [Book] Title: [title of the book] Author: [first-name last-name] Year: [year of publication] Price: [Price as a decimal number with two numbers after decimal]

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      String, the formatted string as above

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object object)
      Books to be considered equal if Title, Author, and Year are equal.

      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      object - , the other object to be compared with this book
      Returns:
      true iff the books are equal Different prices do not invalidate equality
